alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 7:09AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lonoke and east central Pulaski Counties through 745 AM CST... At 709 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Scott, or 12 miles east of Downtown Little Rock, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Lonoke... Carlisle... Keo... McCreanor... Sisemore... Estes... Meto... Toltec Mounds State Park... Scott... South Bend... Baucum... Bevis Corner... Willow Beach... Toltec... Furlow... Woodlawn... Kerr... Terry Lock and Dam... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CST for central Arkansas.
